label: Description
value: Rigid symmetrical design of large, pale pink full-face flowers on center stem and on side stems alternately filled with tiny blue flowers with metal tongues. Flowers on serpentine stem form guard-band at bottom. Pastel silks, metal on silk and flat metal on undyed linen ground. One plain selvage with two-handed finished edges.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: plain cloth, silk and metal on linen Technique: embroidery

label: Description
value: Oblong book with blue cardboard covers contains 46 samples of printed cotton; two have been cut in half.  Six individual patterns balance duplicates. Designs are small scale, printed mostly in bright red, blue green, and dark brown. Probably combination roller and block-printing.  No selvage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cardboard, paper, cotton Technique: block and roller printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (closed): 24.2 x 16.8 x 2 cm (9 1/2 x 6 5/8 x 13/16 in.) 49 pages

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund

label: Description
value: Pattern of curvilinear botanical motifs in light green, dark green, purple, and mustard inks; traces of stenciled gold; paper has been embossed by woodblock and/or stencil processes.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
Instructions for Holding the Pen for Italic Script, incunabulum page

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink over graphite on white laid paper

label: Description
value: Letters various sizes inscribed on a sheet of paper.

label: Provenance
value: William J. Donald; 1954: acquired by Museum
Writing Example from Spieghel der Schrijfkonste. Tweede Deel (The Mirror of Art Writing, Second Part)

label: Description
value: Ornate example of script in the form of a letter. Flourishes include swirls and a crowned eagle at lower left.

label: Provenance
value: William J. Donald; 1954: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Bonnet-like cap of un-dyed linen gathered to arched opening at nape and at crown. Arch at crown filled with reticella; narrow reticello band running along front edge on either side. Broad band of Valencienne bobbin lace forms rectangular brim with confronted animals and double-headed eagle on a heavy mesh ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, needle lace

label: Description
value: Inside an ornamented gilt frame is a sheet of lined note paper, with a basket of forget-me-nots, a paper heart and a girl, attached, upper left. On a double sheet of paper, folded in half, horizontally.

label: Physical description
value: Embossed cut paper, printed in gilt and color lithograph on white wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Dorothy Harrower; 1954: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value:
Part of a large repeat showing a spray of roses and other flowers on a red ground, framed by foliate cartouches, with blue and green grounds outside blue and green enframement.  Continuation of repeat on 1954-23-11 and -13.
Graphite line across top edge; underpainting in green.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on heavy woven paper, lined

label: Description
value:
Part of a large repeat showing a spray of roses and other flowers on a red ground, framed by foliate cartouches, with blue and green grounds outside enframement.  Continuation of repeat on 1954-23-11 and -12. 
Detached section shows verso has printed design: H. blue-green background with white floral design printed on top.  Graphite line drawn at the top and right edge.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on heavy paper, lined

label: Description
value: Long, very fine twill shawl with deep end borders of elongated boteh forms.

label: Description
value: Rectangular box with hinged cover domed from front to back. Ring bail handle on cover, and hinged harp fastening. Painted black with horizontal band of dull gray and upper half of body on front and two ends only. On the front of band and extending below are sprays of acorns and leaves; on each end a small branch of cherries. Colors are vermillion red, yellow, and green, with black lines. Cover has two double sprays of yellow fond-type leaves, with some red, and yellow lines across ends. A continuous border of repeated 3-leaf motif in yellow extends across ends and front.

label: Provenance
value: Box came from house at Fort Ann, Lake Champlain; Mrs. Henry duPont; 1954: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Giff of Mrs. Henry B. duPont

label: Description
value: Rectangular box with hinged cover domed from front to back. Ring bail handle on top of cover and hasp fastener, with staple broken off.  Box is painted black with floral decoration on front and ends of vermillion fruit-like flowers, with white and alizarin markings, and with serrated green leaves and leaf-fronds. Cover is decorated on front and ends with a border of lapped and recumbent "S"s in yellow and similar band with dots frames the top. Spiral arrangement of leaf-fronds in yellow around handle.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Henry B. du Pont; 1954: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henry du Pont
Costume Design: Persian Prince, for a Stage Production Designed by Giuseppe Galli Bibiena

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Full-length of a man, facing the spectator, his head turned toward the left. His right hand is at this hip, the left gesturing. He wears an elaborate brocaded costume, with an ermine-lined cape over it. On his head a turban adored with a plume and jewels. A sword is at his side.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink, gray wash, over pencil on paper

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Interior with three figures. A woman is seated left, facing right, in profile. Beside her, right, stand a boy and a girl, the girl in her confirmation dress and veil.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil and graphite, watercolor, white gouache on Bristol board

label: Description
value: A young girl sitting before a table, with a tool in her hand, modeling a figure in clay. She faces right, in profile. A potted plant or flower arrangement is on the table, right.

label: Description
value: Figure of a bearded peddler of shoe-strings standing beside a lamp post. Other sidewalk vendors in the background. View of city street and buildings beyond.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite and black crayon on cream wove paper, laid down

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Jerome Myers; 1954: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brisé fan. Natural-colored, uncurled ostrich feathers applied to sticks which are tortoise shell to the shoulder; the remainder to the tip is whale bone to which the feathers are attached with thread. Brown satin ribbon.

label: Physical description
value: Ostrich feathers, tortoise shell sticks, silk ribbon

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1954: Ina K. Pitner collection; 1954: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Neutral field, brownish-green trees and ground, pink brick buildings: the first capitol at Albany(?) Top has parrots and tree branches.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased in Memory of Madame Raimondo de Madrazo

label: Description
value: A young girl, sitting before a table, modeling a figure. She faces left, in profile. A potted plant is on the table, left.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in black, colored inks on paper

label: Description
value: A single design unit consisting of a serpentine pattern of flowers and foliage. Boundaries of design indicated by red framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: A single design unit consisting of a serpentine pattern of flowers and foliage. Boundaries of design indicated by red framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper
Governor Lounsbury House, Main Street, Ridgefield, Conn.

label: Description
value: Perspective view of a large house, with a two-story columned portico.

label: Description
value: Twisting ivy leaves, branches and tendrils in all-over pattern. Five shades of green, beige, on glazed white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of W.H.S. Lloyd Company, Inc.

label: Description
value: Fragment of a centennial print in a design of red and blue stars in vertical columns, each star holding in its center a letter, reserved in white, of the word: CENTENNIAL. Intersecting the stars are two horizontal rows: one with 1776, the other 1876.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Horizonal band of Mihrabs each enclosing a simple floral motif with narrow pearled borders and a continuous pearled baseline.  Below is another pearl band off-setting the scrolling floral pattern.  Red, blue and aubergine (blue over red) and reserved areas of white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: resist-dyed and block printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Checkerboard layout of squares with stylized floral rosette in dull red on undyed ground alternating with dull red square with line reserve of profile lotus and leaf rising from triangle base.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block-printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value:
Two small horizontal panels joined by vertical seam. Left panel: Islamic inscription framed top and bottom by plait border, guilloche on right side - reserved on blackish ground. Right panel: rosette interlacing with lotus fillings and narrow interlacing boarder - reddish outlined on undyed ground.  Seemingly part of a cap-band with coarse undyed cotton lining and inner lining.

Translation of Islamic inscription: Glory to our Lord the Sultan.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block-printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Fragment of tightly spun, loosely woven cotton plain weave with flowering boughs drawn in aubergine and crudely colored with red and deep blue.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: painted on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Fragment of tightly spun, loosely woven cotton plain weave with all over pattern of very simple scrolling stems, carnation-like flower heads reserved on deep blue ground, with accents and details painted in red.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: resist-dyed and painted on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Long narrow border of very fine white cotton ornamented with drawn work, embroidery in white, gold thread, black silks and gold fringe at bottom set onto narrow brocaded ribbon on top. Design consists of a double-headed eagle between peacocks with small birds below. Bodies of birds and wings worked in a great variety of designs in very fine drawn work, geometric patterns, embroidered over in white, outlines in gold thread, bird's eyes in black silk. Seven repeats of this group and in each one drawn work designs are different.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread Technique: deflected element work and embroidery

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (exclusive of ribbon and fringe): 127 x 14 cm (50 x 5 1/2 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: A shawl border with a horizontal row of large stylized decorated cones with leafy edges; broad guard border on four sides consisting of octagonal medallions, each framing a floral spray, and oak leaves between. Broad border at the top with a row of decorated mounds with flowery sprays growing on and in them. Small cypress shape in center of each and between each. In a great variety of colors on white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (tapestry) Label: wool and silk dovetail tapestry

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Hand-woven linen with block-printed images in black and dull red-orange.  Design shows two horsemen, confronted, one with spear, one with staff. Above each man an inscription in Russian (inversed, mirror writing).  Fragment is pieced across.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: block printed on plain weave Label: block printed on linen

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Fragment of heavy hand-woven linen in a dark cream color block printed in black. Design is mostly reserved in background color with details in black. Curving vine and stylized flowers forming an allover pattern. Block mark shows across center of piece.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Small fragment of heavy hand-woven natural color linen block printed in blue-green. Design of simple flower heads and smaller dots reserved in natural linen color, details in blue-green.

label: Physical description
value: Meidum: linen Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Small fragment of heavy hand-woven grayish linen block printed in black. Design a series of contiguous circular forms enclosing rosettes. Linen ground color forms most of the design with background and center of circular frame in black.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Textile fragment printed in brown on cream colored cotton. Incomplete design shows a two men with a medallion framing the profile of George III amid dense foliage; an angel with a lyre and banner that reads: Chorus / The Islands Sing/ We Strike the String”. The design covers the right selvage, present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment of cream-white cotton, hand-woven, block-printed in red and brown; design of flower sprays intertwining on very thin much carvd stems. Flowers show Indian influence in drawing and are printed with much interior desgin, of fine picotage in both red and brown. Flowers mainly red, with details in white of ground. Stems and outlines brown.

label: Description
value: Against pale blue-green ground, a fine symmetrical design of cones and foliage in black, green, yellow, orange, red, and violet, with much free-shuttle outline. Triple guard border with small foliage details and cones indicates the edge of one design compartment. One extremely skillful horizontal mend.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: interlocked twill tapestry weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 60 x 21 cm (23 5/8 x 8 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Pieced rectangular panel of fine white wool twill with deep borders on four sides of closely-set, right-facing peacocks with scrolled tails that alternate with small cypress trees rising from an urn. Fine floral motifs fill spaces in between. Embroidered design of cypress and paisley fill the central field. Set-in end borders.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: twill and interlocking twill tapestry weave, embroidered Label: wool 2/2 twill and interlocked twill tapestry with embroidery
